scenes.heading: INT. CHURCH HALL (SUNSET PARK) NIGHT

dialogues.text: My dear Sylvia. Being your sponsor has been a gift. I know you don’t like to hear this, but I really do think you should find yourself a person. So you don’t end up alone like me.
I love you as if you were my own daughter. Maybe because you’re like a child in many ways. I want to take care of you. That’s why I don’t want you
years. That’s longer than most marriages nowadays.
I’m not going to say as much. I’ve only known you for four days... but I can tell how much everyone loves you. I hope I can get to where you are...

I'm very grateful for this space and for all of you and definitely nothing would be possible without you. And I'm very grateful for my daughter. ANNA (13) Sylvia’s daughter, a fresh and confident version of her
Yes! I'm so proud of you.

scenes.actionPreview: It’s Saturday. Sylvia rushes towards Saul’s house, talking on the phone. Isaac is giving her directions on the other end of the line. Reaching behind a potted plant, she picks up the house keys and opens the front door. She ends the call, walks inside and shuts the door. 59 59

scenes.heading: INT. SAUL’S HOUSE - HALLWAY / BATHROOM / SAUL'S BEDROOM.

dialogues.text: I’m calling Isaac so he can send in a doctor.
How long have you been lying there?
I’ll see you in the kitchen. 44.

scenes.actionPreview: No answer. Sylvia heads for Saul’s bedroom. He’s not there. She hears the sound of the shower running. She hears a groan. scenes.heading: INT. SAUL'S HOUSE. KITCHEN. DAY

dialogues.text: I didn't know you were married.
I was. She passed away a long time ago.

scenes.actionPreview: Sylvia and Saul are washing the dishes. They're listening to "A whiter shade of pale" by Proc ol Harum. Saul is telling Sylvia some fun facts about the songs and he talks about his wife. There's an awkward silence in the kitchen. 61 61

scenes.heading: INT. OLIVIA'S HOUSE. NIGHT.

dialogues.text: I want to do the same here. I’ve been in contact with a few organizations.
Are you staying here, for sure? 45.
It doesn’t make sense for me to go back to Miami when you’re here.
Why did you and mom stop talking?
Your mother was out drinking and going out with boys when she was your age. She was out of control, I couldn’t handle her. She kept lying. She would then ask me to stand
She kept making things up... it’s similar to what happened with that man she’s working for now.
Your mother accused him for something he wasn’t guilty of...
That’s different, s he’s a good mother. Though maybe a bit controlling with you, isn’t she?
I’d say not allowing you and I to see each other is controlling.
You stopped talking because of what happened to her in school?
When I stopped standing up for the things she lied about, she stopped talking to us.

scenes.actionPreview: INSERT PHONE SCREEN: PICTURES OF KIDS ON WHEELCHAIRS. Anna is looking at the pictures. In some of them Samantha is hugging the kids. (Printed with the demonstration version of Fade In) What would I go back for? Anna looks at the pictures. up for her and for the things she did while she was drunk...

scenes.heading: INT. SAUL’S HOUSE - KITCHEN. NIGHT

dialogues.text: I’m sorry I’m late... is everything OK?
Yes, but now I’m running late myself.
It’s better if you have your own.
There’s leftover pasta if you’re hungry. My daughter is waiting for me.
Only if I can bring my daughter.

scenes.actionPreview: Saul listens music while eating on the kitchen counter and writing some notes in his notebook. Sylvia does the dishes. Isaac hurries inside. dialogues.text: Is it your turn or mine?

scenes.heading: INT. SAUL’S HOUSE - STUDY / STAIRS / HALLWAY. DAY

dialogues.text: It’s not what it looks like.
He started crying last night while we were watching a film. I wanted to help.

scenes.actionPreview: Sylvia and Saul have spent the night in each other’s arms and are in a deep, peaceful sleep. They don’t hear the front door open. Sylvia continues to sleep while Saul momentarily opens his eyes, then shuts them again. The door inches open. S ara peeks inside, and smiles to see them asleep together.

dialogues.text: She’s not picking up her phone.
Does Samantha visi t them often? 51.
Do they mention her when you’re around?
I don’t want things to get complicated.
I got my job back... it’s better for me to stick to a routine.
Why do you want to stop working with me?
Is it because Sara walked in on us?

scenes.actionPreview: Sylvia waits outside school. Anna comes out. She’s probably with Samantha. They start walking. DAY Sylvia and Anna

dialogues.text: They didn’t want to or you wouldn’t let them?
Why don’t you ever tell me the truth?

scenes.actionPreview: Sylvia enters the house. Anna’s been watching through Sylvia’s bedroom window. coming in? Anna walks over to the window and watches the car drive off. Pensive, Sylvia walks into the kitchen and washes her hands. Sylvia ignores Anna. 69 69

dialogues.text: Let me know so I know if I need to cancel my afternoon appointments... OK... thank you Sylvia.
She said she couldn’t. I didn’t ask why.
I’m going to have to cancel my date with Rachel.
I don’t want to see Rachel, and you don’t have to c ancel your appointments.
You’re staying here, locked up all day?
I’d rather stay here than be taken on your date like a pet.
Could you lend me a notebook?
Hey, sorry I can’t make it tonight... 54.

dialogues.text: I couldn't find anyone to help us today so you'll have to stay here alone.
Unless you want to stay with the neighbors.
Okay. Call me if you need anything. 72

dialogues.text: Saul came by. He’s joining us for dinner.
I was thinking of making something with what we have at home.

scenes.actionPreview: Sylvia and Saul walk to school and wait for Anna. Teenagers start walking out. Anna appears and notices them. She’s surprised to see Saul. Saul waves hello. Anna smiles, trying to be polite. Sylvia’s response further sinks Anna’s mood. The trio walk home. 77 77

dialogues.text: I told you I wanted pizza.
I can go to get pizza. Or I can call them. 57.
No. We're not giving in to this behavior.
What behavior? I just wanted pizza.
Exactly. You know I don't like spicy...
Both of you are belittling me as a chef.

scenes.actionPreview: Sylvia, Saul and Anna are taking lunch in the terrace. (Printed with the demonstration version of Fade In) The three of them starts laughing. 78 78

dialogues.text: I thou ght you weren’t working with him anymore.
I’m not. I’ll be back with Karen on Monday.

I’ve been looking all over for you.
You specifically do what I ask you not to do.
I forgot what you told me not to do.
I haven’t looked at my phone.
Sara showed me the picture of you two. 59.
Let’s go. We’ll talk on the way home.
Would you mind if I stay longer?

dialogues.text: You don’t drink with friends, do you?
No. My mom hardly ever lets me go out. But I don’t like drinking.
Does Ashley smoke or just drink alcohol?
Wh y did you let mom drink?
You think she asked for permission?
Sylvia was a sweet child... Olivia was always jealous of her. Your mom was my favorite. But when she hit her teens she started looking for trouble...
Did she get along with Grandpa better?

scenes.heading: INT. OLIVIA’S HOUSE. DAY

dialogues.text: Where did you get that dress?
You’l l take it off at home. Let’s go.
Anna, tell your mom you want to spend time with me.
You’ll make her live with a man who’s mentally ill?
You protected a pedophile for years. 67.
I will not accept that kind of talk in my house.
I hoped you’d finally stop making things up after so many years...
Are you finally going to remember or are
You saw us inside his room more than once.
Anna, would you rather live here with Olivia?
Tell them how dad used to abuse me when I was a little girl.
You’ve been lying since you learned to talk. Your sister never gave us any problems. You gave us nothing but grief - at school, at home.
Is it my fault you’re a failure?
Dad used to take her to his room and shut the door. He’d say they were going to watch a film together. But he never let me in.
So you remember how they used to watch films together? 69.
You knew what was going on in that room.
Then why didn’t you say anything?
I was confused... I always thought he loved Sylvia more than he loved me. I told you once what I saw and you slapped me.
You slapped me every single time I told you I didn’t like being with dad.

scenes.actionPreview: Robert and Olivia watch TV while Mark and Lucy play Twister with Samantha. We hear Anna and Ashley play with the dog in one of the rooms. The doorbell rings. dialogues.text: We were just hoping to talk
She is not available right now.
Oh okay. Please tell her that we're thinking about her and that we'll come back.

dialogues.text: Why did you keep talking to
You knew all along and never said anything.
That’s not an excuse. If I had a sister I would never do that to her. 71.
I don’t want to see Samantha ever again. I don’t even think I want to talk to you, either.

dialogues.text: Excuse me, I’m looking for Saul

Can you at least tell me if he’s OK?
They found him lying unconscious in the street outside you're house.

dialogues.text: Hi. I just want to know if you’re OK. Then I’ll leave you alone. Are you OK?

dialogues.text: God, grant us the strength to accept the things that we cannot change; the courage to change the things we can; and the wisdom to know the difference.
I have asked a friend to read "What is the AA Program?"
AA is a fellowship of people who share their experience...

scenes.actionPreview: The group is praying. Sylvia is absent-minded while Lorraine speaks. She is not paying attention a t all. 98 98

Can you go upstairs or are you just going to stand right there?
Why haven't you answered my mom's calls?
They took my phone. And my note book.
(cont'd) I'm having a really hard time. They don't let me go outside. The won't even let me go in the kitchen. They don't... Are you sure you don't want something to drink?
Where do you want to go?
